flores_passage: When a small group of organisms (a small number) separates from its larger group (perhaps when they go across a mountain range or river, or when they go to a new island that they cannot easily return to) they will often find themselves in a different place than they were before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new community will need different characteristics or adaptations to be stronger competitors than they needed before. The original creatures have not changed, they still need the same way of life as before. Over time, as the new team begins to adjust to their new environment, they begin to look different from the other team. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two groups will look so different that they cannot be called one species. We call this process formation, which is simply the formation of new species. This creates an irreversible effect and is a very important part of evolution.

flores_passage: The Sundarbans are the world's largest mangrove range, stretching 80 km (50 mi) inland from the coast of Bangladesh and India. The Sundarbans are considered a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Part of the forest in India's territory is called the Sundarbans National Park. The forests are not just swamps and mangroves — they include some of the last remnants of the mighty forests that once covered the Gangetic plain. The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which a third is covered by wetlands. Since 1966 the Sundarbans has been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now around 30,000 Royal Bengal tigers and spotted deer in the area.

mc_answer2: Half of the entire area is covered by swamp
mc_answer3: The largest mangrove belt in the world
mc_answer4: Home to spotted deer and Bengal tigers

Similarly, by having a Schengen visa, you do not need to apply for a visa for each country separately for those that are Schengen members, which saves time, money and the work of filling out forms.

Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage done to the embalmed corpse while trying to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible. flores_passage: Rip currents are backflows from waves coming from the ocean, usually on rocks or similar. Due to the underwater topology the return flow is concentrated in a few deep parts, and a fast current in deep water can form there. Many deaths occur from the exhaustion of trying to swim backwards against the current, which would be impossible. Immediately after you exit the current, swimming back is usually not difficult. Try to understand where you are not stuck and whether, depending on your skills and whether you are marked, you would like to wait for rescue.

flores_passage: Wildlife is the most difficult subject for photographers, and requires a combination of luck, patience, knowledge and the right tools. Wildlife photography is often taken for granted, but as with general photography, a photo says a lot. Wildlife photography usually requires a long-photo lens, although subjects such as flocks of birds or small creatures require other lenses. Many exotic animals are difficult to find, and parks sometimes have rules about taking photos for commercial purposes. Wild animals can be shy or aggressive. The environment can be cold, hot, or otherwise unpleasant.

flores_passage: Anyone driving at high altitudes or over mountain passes must expect the presence of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures. On icy and snowy roads, travel slows down and you can't drive like you would on asphalt. If there is wind along with the snow, enough snow can fall to get you stuck in no time. Visibility can be obstructed by falling or blowing snow or even by moisture or ice on the car window. On the other hand, snow or ice conditions are common in many countries, and vehicles move without interruption almost all year round.

mc_answer3: There is sweat sitting on the windows

flores_passage: The World's Fair (commonly called the World Exposition, or simply Expo) is the world's largest art and science festival. Participating countries represented artists and education that are expressed in national spaces to reflect global problems or their country's culture and history. International Horticultural Expositions are special events that promote flowers, flower gardens and anything related to plants. Although theoretically they can happen every year (as long as they are in different countries), in reality they don't. These events usually last between three and six months, and are held on sites of at least 50 hectares.

flores_passage: Although many animals in the park are used to seeing people, wild animals are still uncivilized and must not be fed or disturbed. According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves like coyotes and 25 yards/meters away from other wildlife! No matter how docile they look, American bison, elk, moose, bears, and almost any large animal can attack. Each year, many tourists are injured because they did not keep the right distance. These animals are large, wild, and can be dangerous, so give them their space. In addition, note that the smell attracts bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking smelly food and keep the camp clean.

mc_answer4: Stopping animals from looking for food scraps
